subject: Dropouts
College Athletics
lead_paragraph: Athletes are earning degrees at record rates, according to an N.C.A.A. report, and at higher percentages than the overall student body. The N.C.A.A. figures showed that 79 percent of student-athletes who entered college in the fall of 2001 graduated and that 78 percent of those who entered between 1998 and 2001 earned degrees within six years. Both are one-point increases over last year’s report and the highest ever. Still, student-athletes who played men’s basketball, football and baseball continued to lag behind those in other sports. ¶Ohio State Coach Jim Tressel committed to Terrelle Pryor as his quarterback, but not all his players agreed. Tight end Jake Ballard said it could help the Buckeyes’ struggling offense to turn to the former starter Todd Boeckman and have him share the job with Pryor, a freshman. No. 12 Ohio State (6-1, 3-0 Big Ten) is last in the Big Ten in passing. buckeyes ¶The highly regarded Southern California women’s basketball player Jacki Gemelos has sustained another season-ending knee injury. Gemelos, a guard, tore the anterior cruciate ligament in her left knee during a workout. Previously, she tore the A.C.L. in her right knee twice. gemelos.
